App.consolewidget module¶

class App.consolewidget.console(master)¶
read()¶

Returns contents of the console widget

write(string)¶

Adds string to the bottom of the console

App.formatting module¶

App.formatting.classes(module)¶

Returns a list of class names defined in module

App.formatting.findstyles(line, *args)¶

Finds any locations of any regex and returns the name of the style and the start and end point in the line

App.formatting.path(fn)¶
App.formatting.userdefined(line)¶

Returns the name of a user defined function or class in a string i.e. def foo(x) -> foo

Module contents¶

Tkinter interface made for Live Coding with Python syntax highlighting

class App.App(widget_title)¶
brackets(event)¶

Inserts and deletes enclosing brackets automatically

delete(event)¶

Deletes a character or selected area

delete2(event)¶

Delete the next character

delete_selection()¶

If an area is selected, it is deleted and returns True

get_code(event)¶

Method to highlight block of code and execute

highlight(start, end)¶

Highlights block of code on execution

indent(event)¶

Indent the current line or selected text

keypress(event=None)¶

Handles any keypress

kill()¶

Proper exit function

killall(event)¶

Ctrl+. function to be defined by the user

newline(event)¶

Adds whitespace to newlines where necessary

paste(event=None)¶

Ctrl-V: Pastes any text and updates the IDE

run()¶

Starts the Tk mainloop for the master widget

selectall(event)¶

Ctrl-a: Select the contents of the IDE

submit(code_str)¶

Placeholder method

tab(event)¶

Move selected text forward 4 spaces

tabspace()¶
terminate()¶

To be overridden by user to be called on window close

text_selected()¶

Returns True if text is selected

unhighlight()¶

Creates thread to wait 0.2 seconds before removing any highlights from the text

unindent(event)¶

Moves the current row or selected text back by 4 spaces

update(event=None, row=0)¶

Updates the the colours of the IDE
